channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Video of Chinese student 'on a hunt for Barron Trump' viral. People call her crazy, delusional
item.description: A Chinese social media influencer has claimed she will be hunting for Barron Trump at New York University's Stern School of Business, where he studies. She described her elaborate plan involving spies and gifts, which has gone viral online. All eyes follow Barron Trump at NYU since he started his class there. The student in the viral video said two bodyguards protect Barron Trump even inside the classroom.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump ratchets up anti-immigrant rhetoric, says he will go to Springfield
item.description: Springfield, Ohio, famous from The Simpsons, faces tension over a proposed visit by Donald Trump due to his false claims about immigrants. Local Republicans urge him to stay away. Trump continues pushing conspiracy theories on illegal voting ahead of the 2024 elections against Kamala Harris, despite evidence showing non-citizen voting is rare.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: What we know about Kamala Harris' gun
item.description: Kamala Harris disclosed during a presidential debate that she owns a handgun for personal protection, influenced by her career as a prosecutor. Despite owning a firearm, she supports stricter gun control laws such as an assault weapons ban and background checks. Harris argues that advocating for the Second Amendment and sensible regulations are not mutually exclusive.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​Kennedy Jr dismisses sexting allegations, says he met Olivia Nuzzi only once for interview
item.description: ​31-year-old Nuzzi did not name Kennedy Jr but admitted that some communication between her and a former reporting subject turned personal earlier this year. She elaborated that the relationship was not physical and was only limited to chats. "During that time, I did not directly report on the subject nor use them as a source. The relationship was never physical but should have been disclosed to prevent the appearance of a conflict. I deeply regret not doing so immediately and apologize to those I've disappointed, especially my colleagues at New York," Nuzzi said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Laura Loomer spills the beans on who plants hit pieces about JD Vance in media
item.description: Laura Loomer said Kellyanne Conway is not loyal to Donald Trump, plants hit pieces about Trump's running mate JD Vance in the media after Conway said she was baffled that Laura Loomer was travelling with Donald Trump on his jet. "Kellyanne Conway isn’t concerned about the fact that her own family members bash and attack Donald Trump on a daily basis though. You’ll never see her condemn that. They say vile things and she refuses to condemn them. She is disloyal to Donald Trump. Everyone knows it too," Laura said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'As if keeping women humble...': Kamala Harris' husband has this to say about 'biological children'
item.description: Kamala Harris' husband Doug Emhoff replied to Sarah Sander's jibe that Kamala Harris does not have biological children to humble her. Doug said humbling women is not something they are striving for and American women will never humble themselves before Donald Trump but Kamala did humbled Donald Trump in the ABC News debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is Israel focusing on border with Lebanon?
item.description: A series of deadly explosions targeting Hezbollah members this week in Lebanon came only days after Israel announced plans to expand its war in Gaza to its northern border with Lebanon. - Since the Gaza war began almost a year ago, Israel and Hamas ally Hezbollah have engaged in near-daily cross-border clashes.

item.title: Who is New York's Dr Jay Varma who attended sex parties while preaching Covid social distancing?
item.description: Dr. Jay Varma, who managed New York City's Covid response, confessed to attending sex parties during the pandemic while publicly promoting social distancing. In several video recordings about which he had no idea, the epidemiologist bragged how he and his wife used to sneak to underground sex and drug parties. “The only way I could do this job for the city was if I had some way to blow off steam every now and then," he said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump vs Kamala Harris: Who has said what about gun violence?
item.description: Kamala Harris has highlighted her firearm ownership while advocating for stricter gun control measures during her presidential campaign. This contrasts with former President Donald Trump’s strong support for gun rights and the NRA. The article delves into their differing strategies on addressing gun violence in the US.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Booby-trapped devices smuggled in before deadly explosions: Lebanon UN mission
item.description: Lebanese authorities discovered that hand-held devices such as pagers and walkie-talkies were booby-trapped before entering the country. The explosions targeted Hezbollah-linked users, killing 37 people and injuring nearly 3,000. Lebanon accused Israel of orchestrating the attacks and urged the UN Security Council to condemn them.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine restricts use of Telegram by officials over national security risks
item.description: Ukraine has limited the use of Telegram for government, military, and security officials due to national security risks. The National Security and Defence Council stated that Russia might access personal data and messages on the app. Officials who rely on Telegram for their work are not affected by this restriction.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brussels Airlines to cancel most October 1 flights amid nationwide strike
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From Sean 'Diddy' Combs to Harvey Weinstein: List of celebrities facing sexual misconduct charges
Sean 'Diddy' Combs placed on 'suicide watch' after arrest in sex trafficking case: Reports
item.description: Sean 'Diddy' Combs, aged 54, is currently on suicide watch at Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center as he awaits trial for sex trafficking charges. After being denied bail twice, he was moved to the MDC on September 17. His legal team has highlighted concerns regarding the facility's dangerous conditions and sought his transfer to another location.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Typhoon Pulasan': Second typhoon hits Shanghai days after a historic storm
item.description: Shanghai was hit by major flooding on Friday as Typhoon Pulasan made landfall in the Fengxian district with wind speeds of 83 km/h. This came just after the city was recovering from Typhoon Bebinca. Heavy rain persisted into Friday morning, but no severe damage or injuries were reported. By 11am, many flooded areas had been cleared.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Chilling video shows teenager sneaking into mother's bedroom to kill her
item.description: Carly Gregg, a 15-year-old girl from Mississippi, faces charges of murder and attempted murder after allegedly killing her mother and shooting her stepfather. The incident occurred following the discovery of her drug use by her mother. Surveillance footage captures the events leading up to the crime. Gregg is pursuing an insanity defense.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Have your head examined': Trump suggests Jews partly responsible if he loses
item.description: At a pro-Israel conference in Washington DC, former US President Donald Trump criticised American Jewish voters supporting Kamala Harris. He warned of existential threats to Israel if Harris wins the election. Trump also addressed rising antisemitism on college campuses and vowed to revoke federal support for universities allowing antisemitic propaganda.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Python attacks, squeezes Thai woman for two hours before rescue
item.description: Arom Arunroj, a 64-year-old woman from near Bangkok, Thailand, was attacked by a large python while doing dishes. The snake bit her thigh and constricted her for almost two hours before neighbors alerted authorities. She sustained minor bites and was freed when police struck the snake with a crowbar.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: TikTok’s Tanghulu trend: Glass fruit treat turns sour with severe burn injuries among children
item.description: A TikTok trend called Tanghulu, involving boiling sugar and water to create "glass fruit," has led to a surge in severe burn injuries among children. Medical professionals caution that melted sugar can cause deep burns. Parents should ensure their children know proper cooking safety before trying this trend at home.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If you're exhausted by craziness ... ': Kamala Harris, Oprah team up for high-profile event in Michigan
item.description: Oprah Winfrey endorsed Kamala Harris’s presidential campaign during a virtual rally in Oakland County, Michigan. She urged undecided voters to support Harris for a better future. The event featured personal stories from families affected by violence and included participation from celebrities like Chris Rock and Jennifer Lopez, highlighting the urgency for change.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
